title: "How-Big-Cheatsheet"
author: "Steve Simon"
date: "September 17, 2016"
output: html_document
---

The first figure illustrates the margins. Start with the assumption that the graph is seven inches by seven inches and that mar=c(5.1, 4.1, 4.1, 2.1) and mai=c(1.02, 0.82, 0.82, 0.42)
which means 5 lines per inch. Also assume that there are 96 pixels per inch.

```{r margins, fig.width=5.25, fig.height=5.25}
dev.size()
dev.size(units="px")/dev.size()
par("mar")
par("mai")
par("mar")/par("mai")
par("plt")
par("pin")
# test plot
par(mgp=c(1,4,0))
plot(0:1, 0:1, type="n", axes=FALSE, xlab="x", ylab="y")
box()
axis(side=1)
axis(side=2)
title("title")
par(mar=rep(0, 4), xaxs="i", yaxs="i")
plot(c(-1,7), c(-1,7), type="n", axes=FALSE)

x <- c(
  0,
  0+0.41,
  0+0.82,
  0+0.82+0.04*(7-0.82-0.42),
  0+0.82+0.25*(7-0.82-0.42),
  0+0.82+0.75*(7-0.82-0.42),
  7-0.42-0.04*(7-0.82-0.42),
  7-0.42,
  7-0.21,
  7)
y <- c(
  0,
  0+0.51,
  0+1.02,
  0+1.02+0.04*(7-1.02-0.84),
  0+1.02+0.25*(7-1.02-0.84),
  0+1.02+0.75*(7-1.02-0.84),
  7-0.82-0.04*(7-1.02-0.82),
  7-0.82,
  7-0.41,
  7)

axis(side=1, pos=1.02, at=x[c(4,7)], labels=rep(" ", 2)) 
axis(side=2, pos=0.82, at=y[c(4,7)], labels=rep(" ", 2)) 

polygon(
  x=x[c(3, 8, 8 ,3)],
  y=y[c(3, 3, 8, 8)],
  density=NA, col="gray90", border=NA)

polygon(
  x=x[c(4, 7, 7 ,4)],
  y=y[c(4, 4, 7, 7)],
  density=NA, col="gray90", border="black", lty="dotted")

s2 <- " dev.size()[1] (in, cm, px) "
s1 <- "fin[1] (in)"
w <- strwidth(s2)
text(x[5], y[1]-0.4, paste(s1, s2, sep="\n"))
arrows(x[5]-w/2, y[1]-0.4, x[1], y[1]-0.4, len=0.05)
arrows(x[5]+w/2, y[1]-0.4, x[10], y[1]-0.4, len=0.05)

segments(x[1], y[1]-0.1, x[1], y[1]-0.7)
segments(x[10], y[1]-0.1, x[10], y[1]-0.7)

s4 <- " dev.size()[2] (in, cm, px) "
s3 <- "fin[2] (in)"
w <- strwidth(s4)
text(x[1]-0.4, y[5], paste(s3, s4, sep="\n"), srt=90)
arrows(x[1]-0.4, y[5]-w/2, x[1]-0.4, y[1], len=0.05)
arrows(x[1]-0.4, y[5]+w/2, x[1]-0.4, y[10], len=0.05)

segments(x[1]-0.1, y[1], x[1]-0.7, y[1])
segments(x[1]-0.1, y[10], x[1]-0.7, y[10])

s7 <- "usr[1:2] (user)"
s6 <- "plt[1:2] (pct)"
s5 <- "pin[1:2] (in)"
w <- strwidth(s7)
arrows(x[6]-w/2, y[5], x[3], y[5], len=0.05)
arrows(x[6]+w/2, y[5], x[8], y[5], len=0.05)
text(x[6], y[5], paste(s5, s6, s7, sep="\n"))

s10 <- "usr[3:4] (user)"
s9 <- "plt[3:4] (pct)"
s8 <- "pin[3:4] (in)"
h <- 5*strheight(s10)
arrows(x[5], y[6]-h/2, x[5], y[3], len=0.05)
arrows(x[5], y[6]+h/2, x[5], y[8], len=0.05)
text(x[5], y[6], paste(s8, s9, s10, sep="\n"))

arrows(
  x[3],     y[1],
  x[3],     y[3], length=0.05, code=3)
segments(
  x[3],     y[2]-0.1,
  x[3]+0.3, y[2]-0.1, length=0.05)
text(
  x[3]+0.5, y[2]-0.1, 
  "mai[1] (in)\nmar[1] (lines)", adj=0, cex=1.0)

arrows(
  x[8],     y[8],
  x[8],     y[10], length=0.05, code=3)
segments(
  x[8],     y[9],
  x[8]-0.3, y[9], length=0.05)
text(
  x[8]-0.5, y[9], 
  "mai[3] (in)\nmar[3] (lines)", adj=1, cex=1.0)

arrows(
  x[1], y[8],
  x[3], y[8], length=0.05, code=3)
segments(
  x[2], y[8],
  x[3]+0.5, y[9])
text(
  x[3]+0.5, y[9],
  "mai[2] (in)\nmar[2] (lines)", adj=0, cex=1.0)

arrows(
  x[8],     y[3],
  x[10],     y[3], length=0.05, code=3)
segments(
  x[9],     y[3],
  x[9]-0.5, y[2]-0.1)
text(
  x[9]-0.5, y[2]-0.1,
  "mai[4] (in)\nmar[4] (lines)", adj=1, cex=1.0)

polygon(
  x=x[c(1, 10, 10, 1)],
  y=y[c(1, 1, 10, 10)],
  lty="dashed")
```
